text: Ephraim herds \add the\add* wind\f + \fr 12:1 \ft Or “Ephraim befriends \fq the \ft wind” \f*
and \add is\add* pursuing \add the\add* east wind all day long;
he multiplies deception and violence
and he\f + \fr 12:1 \ft Hebrew “they” \f* ⸤makes a treaty with Assyria⸥,\f + \fr 12:1 \ft Literally “cuts a covenant with Assyria” \f*
and oil is brought to Egypt.
Yahweh has a quarrel\f + \fr 12:2 \ft This word in Hebrew conveys a legal setting \f* with Judah
and will punish Jacob according to his ways
and repay him according to his deeds.
In the womb he deceived his brother,
and in his manhood he struggled with God.
He struggled with \add the\add* angel and prevailed;
he pleaded for his mercy.
He met him at Bethel,
and there he spoke with him.\f + \fr 12:4 \ft Hebrew “us” \f*
Yahweh the God of hosts,
Yahweh \add is\add* his renowned name!
But you, you must return to your God;
keep love and justice,
and wait continually for your God.
\add The\add* trader, in his hand \add are\add* scales of deceit;\f + \fr 12:7 \ft Or “false balances” \f*
he loves to oppress.
And Ephraim said, “Surely, I am rich,
I gained\f + \fr 12:8 \ft Or “I found” \f* wealth for myself;
in all my toil they have not found guilt in me
that is \add sin\add*.
But I \add am\add* Yahweh your God
since\f + \fr 12:9 \ft Or “from” \f* the land of Egypt;
I will make you live in tents again,
like the days of \add the\add* appointed festival.
I spoke to the prophets;
I myself multiplied revelations\f + \fr 12:10 \ft Hebrew “revelation” \f*
and through the hand of the prophets I will destroy.
If \add in\add* Gilead \add there is\add* evil,
surely they will come to nothing.
In Gilgal they sacrifice bulls,
also their altars will be like stone heaps
on furrows of \add the\add* field.
Jacob fled \add to\add* the open field of Aram,\f + \fr 12:12 \ft Or “the land of Aram” \f*
and Israel served for a wife,
and for a wife he watched over \add sheep\add*.
And by a prophet Yahweh brought
Israel up from Egypt,
and by a prophet
he\f + \fr 12:13 \ft Israel \f* was watched over.
Ephraim has caused bitter provocation,
and his Lord will ⸤hold him responsible for his crimes⸥\f + \fr 12:14 \ft Literally “will bring down on him his blood” \f*
and pay back to him his insults.
